benchmark_details.name: LLMC (Large Language Model Compression)
benchmark_details.overview: LLMC is a versatile compression toolkit that benchmarks the quantization of large language models by considering calibration data, quantization algorithms, and data formats to systematically explore their impacts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of LLMC is to provide a comprehensive, modular toolkit for benchmarking various quantization methods for large language models to enhance their deployment efficiency.

data.source: Calibration datasets such as Pile and WikiText2, and various downstream evaluation datasets.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model evaluations against standard datasets for various quantization methods.
methodology.interpretation: Lower PPL and higher accuracy indicate better performance in quantized models.
methodology.validation: Results are validated through comparative analysis against existing quantization methods.
